transcript.text: I mean commercial television is much
less constrained than public television
public television is more liberal uh and
it's therefore much more ideological and
imposes much narrower constraints they
don't allow deviant uh that's pretty con
constant uh but yeah they don't want uh
I mean not in their interest to have
people talk about things like this
sometimes they're pressured and they'll
allow a couple of minutes here and there
there uh and it's kind of interesting
the way it works so the television's
mostly out except for commercial cable
television but uh radio is a little
Freer National Public Radio is
considered the Liber you know the kind
of outer limits of the left in the
United States very small but it's
considered very distant and they're the
ones with the sharpest restrictions by
far I mean they won't allow a millimeter
of deviation from the party line uh but
sometimes they are under pressure to do
it it's interesting the way it works so
for example during the first Gulf War
I'm pretty well known around Boston you
know and that's happens to be the center
the ideological Center for national
public radio it's their Flagship station
and all that sort of thing uh and
there's a lot of pressure there to let

first Gulf War they did approach me and
they told me I would be allowed to have
two and a half
minutes uh however uh they insisted that

ensure that it's you know okay uh and
once they approved it I had to read it
and they pre-recorded it to make sure

uh uh you know that went off the limits
uh the first time I I thought it's kind

staff's mostly laughing the engineers

reading took 2 minutes and 36 seconds uh
so they told me no I got to reread it uh
and uh so I read it a little faster got

then they actually did run it uh and
there are other things like that I'll
just mention one other case same
National Public Radio again the kind of

of pressure often they say have
something about books of mine around 10

was based on lectures over
CBC uh and it was actually was

starts at 5:00 and then you know every
educated person is supposed to listen to

they were going to have review of this

called me up and said ah great it's
going to be on uh it got to 5:30 it got
to
525 at 525 the program stopped and there
were five minutes of music you know uh
at 5:30 when they move into the next

know what happened to that five minute

know what happened to the review so
after about 10 minutes U I got a call

that's off at the left liberal end of
